appendix.title: Tinkar Model Concepts (In Progress)
appendix.para: The Tinkar core architecture is designed to be extremely flexible. This flexibility supports the ability to assert relationships among diverse terminologies and to support change in the design of those terminologies. However, it means that there may be more than one way to support any specific requirement.
We propose the following members of the Tinkar Model Concepts (a.k.a. infrastructure concepts).
Below is an example of a subset of Tinkar Model Concepts. The full list and definitions of the core Tinkar Model Concepts is in progress and will be completed by the ballot submission deadline.

listitem.para: User: An agent that may be responsible for authoring a change.

Content license: Official permision to use intellectual property.
Apache 2 license: A permissive free software license written by the Apache Software Foundation.
CC_BY_LICENSE: A license used when an author wants to give other people the right to share, use, and build upon a work that they have created.
Copyright: A type of intellectual property that gives its owner the exclusive right to make copies of a creative work, usually for a limited time.
Description semantic set: A semantic set specifying how a concept is described.
Dependency management semantic set: A semantic set specifying how modules depend on one another.
Dialect semantic set: A semantic set enumerating descriptions in a specified dialect.
GB English dialect: A semantic set enumerating descriptions in GB English.
US English dialect: A semantic set enumerating descriptions in US English.
US Nursing dialect: A semantic set enumerating descriptions in US English tailored for nursing use.
